column4: I just upgraded to breezy. But the 2.6.12 kernel panics. Any ideas?
yeah i got an idea that you should try that same question with the information on WHAT THE PANIC IS !
it says something about the filesystem. VFS stuff
any idea how to fix it?
if you can list the /boot dir check that /boot/initrd.img points to the new version   ls -l /boot
/boot/initrd.img doesn't exist
any initrd* anything in there.
don't work
sudo grub-install /dev/hda    <--- assuming ide hard drive there.
nope
I found the problem
share it.
my /boot was full
good point, i wasn't working on 'why' i was only working on what to do about it.    thanks for the jolt.   :)
to fix it, you make free space
what is the file size of your initrd?
i'm not using ubuntu nor the 2.6 kernel  ask someone that is.
it still could be the map file or something in /boot/grub
what?
I'm checking that I got the whole file before I reboot :)
